medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started yesterday at 6pm after the patient had eaten at 5pm. It began in the right upper quadrant and is described as cramping in nature, radiating to her back. The patient reports associated symptoms of nausea and vomiting, but denies having fevers, chills, or diarrhea. She has experienced similar pain one time before, years ago, related to gallstones.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes Type II, Hyperlipidemia, Hypertension, Gastroesophageal reflux, Osteoarthritis, Obesity, Depression, Anxiety, Cholelithiasis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with stroke and diabetes mellitus; Father with stroke; Maternal grandmother (deceased) with diabetes mellitus and stroke; Sister living with cyst.
